update.description:
Changes made to match the new [Task message fields](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/srcsim/src/7e12e7debaf46229baf397b398924167648e9a5e/msg/Task.msg?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default) in the new release of srcsim 0.6.0.

Also started monitoring Score data.

Note this PR changes the JSON data that will be posted back to the portal.

~~~
{
  round_1: {
    tasks: [{
      current_checkpoint: 3,
      start_time: 0.0,
      elapsed_time: 0.0,
      timed_out: false,
      finished: false,
      checkpoint_durations: [0.0, 0.0],
      checkpoint_penalties: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]
      }, null, null]
    score: 0,
    total_completion_time: 0.0
  }
}

~~~

* `round` will now be suffixed with `_n` where `n` is from 1 to 5

* added `score`, and `total_completion_time` to `round_*` data 

* `tasks` is now an array. Note it can have null elements because competitors can skip tasks, e.g. `tasks:[null, {current_checkpoint: 0, etc}, null]`

* `checkpoints_completion` is now `checkpoint_durations`

* new `checkpoint_penalties` array in `tasks`
update.title: Update SRC monitor with new Task and Score data

content.html:
Followed the steps from pull request #52 , launched Round 1 , did the suggested steps. Then stopped round 1 and launched round 2 , and applied same steps. I can see this info in srcsimulation (at portal):

        "simulator": {
          "state_machine": "RUNNING",
          "ready": true,
          "round_1": {
            "tasks": [
              {
                "checkpoint_durations": [
                  0.002
                ],
                "current_checkpoint": 2,
                "start_time": 42.011,
                "timed_out": false,
                "elapsed_time": 40.003,
                "finished": false,
                "checkpoint_penalties": [
                  0,
                  0
                ]
              },
              null,
              null
            ],
            "total_completion_time": 0.002,
            "score": 1
          },
          "round_2": {
            "tasks": [
              {
                "checkpoint_durations": [],
                "current_checkpoint": 1,
                "start_time": 22.506,
                "timed_out": false,
                "elapsed_time": 0.001,
                "finished": false,
                "checkpoint_penalties": [
                  0
                ]
              },
              null,
              null
            ],
            "total_completion_time": 0,
            "score": 0
          }
        },

So I think this is OK .

Thanks Ian!
